meanings.definition: To change or transform in a surprising or magical manner.
meanings.sent1: The wizard transmogrifies a pumpkin into a carriage with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar transmogrifies into a beautiful butterfly after some time.
meanings.sent3: The old book transmogrifies into a talking parrot, much to the surprise of the librarian.
meanings.sent4: Her smile transmogrifies the gloomy room into a bright and cheerful space.
meanings.sent5: The potion transmogrifies the ordinary rock into a shimmering crystal.

meanings.definition: To alter or distort in a strange or grotesque way.
meanings.sent1: The artist transmogrifies reality into a surreal masterpiece on canvas.
meanings.sent2: The funhouse mirror transmogrifies your reflection into a wobbly, elongated figure.
meanings.sent3: The prankster transmogrifies his friend's face in the photo to look like a cartoon character.
meanings.sent4: The dark fog transmogrifies the once familiar landscape into a foreboding realm.
meanings.sent5: The nightmare transmogrifies the peaceful dream into a chaotic and unsettling experience.
